snippet.textDisplay: @RokuroCarisu it depends on your interpretation. I see firebrand as a somber figure, one who's more wanton days of violence are behind him. He recognizes the mistakes he made in the past, and moves now with PURPOSE.
snippet.textOriginal: @RokuroCarisu it depends on your interpretation. I see firebrand as a somber figure, one who's more wanton days of violence are behind him. He recognizes the mistakes he made in the past, and moves now with PURPOSE.

It's an awesome piece for sure, but I think its way too... serene to be the theme of a character like Firebrand.
I'd suggest either Challenge of Devils, Cursed Towers, or maybe a rock version of Legend of Firebrand.
snippet.textOriginal:
It's an awesome piece for sure, but I think its way too... serene to be the theme of a character like Firebrand.
I'd suggest either Challenge of Devils, Cursed Towers, or maybe a rock version of Legend of Firebrand.

snippet.textDisplay: they dont make games like this anymore :(. I have played PS3,Wii and 360 (first two I own) but still SNES in its own right had one hell of a library of great games and Demons Crest is one of them. This song brings nostalgia everytime I hear it. I hope this game gets added to the Wii shop channel soon. A very underrated game that deserves better. Demons Crest gets a score of 9/10 from me :).
snippet.textOriginal: they dont make games like this anymore :(. I have played PS3,Wii and 360 (first two I own) but still SNES in its own right had one hell of a library of great games and Demons Crest is one of them. Brilliant choice.
